title: Fleetway Travel close to sale
text:
Save 
Fleetway Travel is set to be snapped up by private equity firm Synova Capital. 
The deal is valued at around £23 million. Some of the management team including Ben Braude and James Clarke will stay on at the firm under the new ownership. 
In the year to October 31, 2014 Fleetway Travel Ltd reported a 141% rise in pre-tax profit to £2.5m on turnover of £39.8m. 
The company’s growth is largely down to its use of third-party deals websites such as Travelzoo and Secret Escapes. 
Fleetway represents Synova’s first foray into the travel sector. It has previously backed accessories and handbags supplier TLG Brands and insurance broker Stackhouse Poland. 
The Sunday Times reported that the former chief executive of Saga Holidays, Ian Coghlan would join as executive chairman. 
Neither Synova Capital, nor Fleetway Travel responded to requests for comment.
